==Events==
*[[48 BC]] &ndash; [[Pompey|Pompey the Great]] is assassinated on the orders of King [[Ptolemy XIII Theos Philopator|Ptolemy]] of [[Egypt]] after landing in [[Egypt]].
* [[235]] &ndash; [[Pope Pontian]] resigns. He and [[Hippolytus (writer)|Hippolytus]], church leader of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]], are exiled to the [[mining|mines]] of [[Sardinia]].
* [[351]] &ndash; [[Battle of Mursa Major]]: the [[Roman Emperor]] [[Constantius II]] defeats the [[Roman usurper|usurper]] [[Magnentius]].
* [[365]] &ndash; Roman usurper [[Procopius (usurper)|Procopius]] bribes two [[Roman legion|legion]]s passing by [[Constantinople]], and proclaims himself [[Roman emperor]].
* [[935]] &ndash; [[Saint Wenceslas]] is murdered by his brother, [[Boleslaus I of Bohemia]].
* [[995]] &ndash; Members of [[Slavník's dynasty]] &ndash; [[Spytimír]], Pobraslav, Pořej and Čáslav are murdered by Boleslaus's son, [[Boleslav II of Bohemia|Boleslaus II the Pious]].
*[[1066]] &ndash; [[William the Conqueror|William the Bastard]] (as he was known at the time) invades England beginning the [[Norman conquest of England]].
*[[1106]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Tinchebray]] &ndash; [[Henry I of England]] defeats his brother, [[Robert Curthose]].
*[[1238]] &ndash; Muslim [[Valencia]] surrenders to the besieging King [[James I of Aragon]] the Conqueror.
*[[1322]] &ndash; [[Louis IV, Holy Roman Emperor]] defeats [[Frederick I of Austria (Habsburg)|Frederick I of Austria]] in the [[Battle of Mühldorf]].
*[[1448]] &ndash; [[Christian I of Denmark|Christian I]] is crowned king of Denmark.
*[[1538]] &ndash; [[Ottoman–Venetian War (1537–1540)|Ottoman–Venetian War]]: The [[Ottoman Navy]] scores a decisive victory over a [[Holy League (1571)|Holy League]] fleet in the [[Battle of Preveza]].
*[[1542]] &ndash; Navigator [[Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo]] of Portugal arrives at what is now [[San Diego, California]], United States.
*[[1779]] &ndash; [[American Revolution]]: [[Samuel Huntington (statesman)|Samuel Huntington]] is elected [[President of the Continental Congress]], succeeding [[John Jay]].
*[[1781]] &ndash; American forces backed by a French fleet begin the [[siege of Yorktown]], [[Virginia]], during the [[American Revolutionary War]].
*[[1787]] &ndash; The newly completed [[United States Constitution]] is [[History of the United States Constitution|voted on]] by the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] to be sent to the [[State legislature (United States)|state legislature]]s for approval.
*[[1791]] &ndash; France becomes the first country to [[Jewish emancipation|emancipate]] its Jewish population.
*[[1844]] &ndash; [[Oscar I of Sweden|Oscar I]] of [[Sweden-Norway]] is crowned king of Sweden.
*[[1867]] &ndash; Toronto becomes the capital of [[Ontario]].
*  1867   &ndash; The United States takes control of [[Midway Atoll|Midway Island]].
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Battle of Alcolea (1868)|Battle of Alcolea]] causes Queen [[Isabella II of Spain]] to flee to France.
*[[1871]] &ndash; Brazilian Parliament passes the Law of the Free Womb, granting freedom to all new children born to slaves, the first major step in the eradication of slavery in [[Brazil]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Riot]]s break out in [[Montreal]] to protest against compulsory [[smallpox]] vaccination.
*[[1889]] &ndash; The first [[General Conference on Weights and Measures]] (CGPM) defines the length of a meter as the distance between two lines on a standard bar of an alloy of [[platinum]] with ten percent [[iridium]], measured at the melting point of ice.
*[[1892]] &ndash; The first [[night game]] for [[American football]] takes place [[1892 Wyoming Seminary vs. Mansfield State Normal football game|in a contest]] between [[Wyoming Seminary]] and [[Mansfield University of Pennsylvania|Mansfield State Normal]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; [[Philippine–American War]]: Filipino guerrillas kill more than forty American soldiers while losing 28 of their own, in a [[Balangiga massacre|surprise attack]] in the town of [[Balangiga, Eastern Samar|Balangiga]] on [[Samar Island]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; The [[Ulster Covenant]] is signed by half a million Ulster Protestants in opposition to the [[Third Irish Home Rule Bill]].
*  1912   &ndash; Corporal [[Frank S. Scott]] of the United States Army becomes the first enlisted man to die in an airplane crash. He and pilot Lt. Lewis C. Rockwell are killed in the crash of an Army [[Wright Model B]] at [[College Park, Maryland]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[Fifth Battle of Ypres]] begins.
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Omaha Race Riot of 1919|Race riots]] begin in [[Omaha, Nebraska]], US.
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[First aerial circumnavigation|First round-the-world]] flight completed. 
*[[1928]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|U.K. Parliament]] passes the Dangerous Drugs Act outlawing [[cannabis (drug)|cannabis]].<!-- This may not be the correct date - needs checking -->
*  1928   &ndash; [[Alexander Fleming|Sir Alexander Fleming]] notices a [[bacterium|bacteria]]-killing [[mold]] growing in his laboratory, discovering what later became known as [[penicillin]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Nazi Germany]] and the [[Soviet Union]] [[German–Soviet Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Demarcation|agree]] on a division of Poland after their invasion during [[World War II]].
*  1939   &ndash; [[Warsaw]] surrenders to Nazi Germany during World War II.
*[[1941]] &ndash; The [[Drama Uprising]] against the [[Bulgaria]]n [[Axis occupation of Greece|occupation]] in northern [[Greece]] begins.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Soviet Army]] troops liberate [[Klooga concentration camp]] in [[Klooga]], [[Estonia]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Indonesia]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[CBS]] makes the first [[color television]]s available for sale to the general public, but the product is discontinued less than a month later.
*[[1958]] &ndash; France ratifies a new [[Constitution of France]]; the [[French Fifth Republic]] is then formed upon the formal adoption of the new [[constitution]] on [[October 4]]. [[Guinea]] rejects the new [[constitution]], voting for independence instead.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Mali]] and [[Senegal]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; A [[military coup]] in [[Damascus]] effectively ends the [[United Arab Republic]], the union between [[Egypt]] and [[Syria]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Paddington tram depot fire]] destroys 65 [[tram]]s in [[Brisbane]], Australia.
*[[1963]] - ''[[Whaam!]]'', now considered [[Roy Lichtenstein]]'s most important work, debuted at an exhibition held at the [[Leo Castelli Gallery]] that lasted until at October 24.
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[President of Egypt|Egyptian President]] [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] dies of a [[myocardial infarction|heart attack]] in [[Cairo]]. [[Anwar Sadat]] is named as Nasser's temporary successor, and will later become the permanent successor. 
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of the United Kingdom]] passes the [[Misuse of Drugs Act 1971]] banning the medicinal use of cannabis.
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[ITT Corporation|ITT]] Building in New York City is bombed in protest at ITT's alleged involvement in the [[Chilean coup of 1973|September 11, 1973 coup d'état]] in [[Chile]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Spaghetti House siege]], in which nine people are taken hostage, takes place in London.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The car ferry {{MS|Estonia}} sinks in [[Baltic Sea]], killing 852 people.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Bob Denard]] and a group of mercenaries take the islands of [[Comoros]] in a [[History of Comoros|coup]].
*  1995   &ndash; Israeli Prime Minister [[Yitzhak Rabin]] and PLO Chairman [[Yasser Arafat]] sign the [[Interim Agreement on the West Bank and the Gaza Strip]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; Former president of Afghanistan [[Mohammad Najibullah]] is tortured and brutally murdered by the [[Taliban]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Al-Aqsa Intifada]]: [[Ariel Sharon]] visits [[Al-Aqsa Mosque]] known to Jews as the [[Temple Mount]] in [[Jerusalem]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Suvarnabhumi Airport]] opens in [[Bang Phli District|Amphoe Bang Phli]], [[Samut Prakan Province]] from [[Don Mueang International Airport]] after the older airport ceased international commercial flights.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[SpaceX]] launches the first private [[spacecraft]], the [[Falcon 1]] into orbit.
*[[2009]] &ndash; The military junta leading [[Guinea]], headed by [[Moussa Dadis Camara|Captain Moussa Dadis Camara]], raped, killed, and wounded protesters during [[2009 Guinea protest|a protest rally]] in a stadium called [[Stade du 28 Septembre]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Somali Armed Forces|Somali]] and [[African Union Mission to Somalia|African Union]] forces launch a coordinated [[Battle of Kismayo (2012)|assault]] on the Somali port city of [[Kismayo]] to take back the city from [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] militants.
*  2012   &ndash; A [[Dornier Do 228]] light aircraft [[Sita Air Flight 601|crashes]] on the outskirts of the [[Nepal|Nepalese]] capital of [[Kathmandu]], killing 19 people.
